video.title: Unreal Engine & C++ Tutorial - 1st Person Shooter Game
video.description:
Learn how to use Unreal Engine and C++ to create monster shooter game.

✏️ Course created by Fahir from Awesome Tuts. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5c-DuzPdH9iaWYdI0v0uzw
🔗 More tutorials from Fahir: https://awesometuts.com/

💻 Assets and Code: https://cdn.fs.teachablecdn.com/HVnF0XHHS3C8GxModarr

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Game Preview
⌨️ (0:02:43) Creating The Player Character
⌨️ (0:22:17) Creating The Character Blueprint
⌨️ (0:29:23) Player Movement
⌨️ (0:37:41) The Projectile Class
⌨️ (0:47:54) Shooting The Projectile
⌨️ (1:02:41) Creating The Enemy And Enemy Animations
⌨️ (1:11:59) AI Perception Component Setup
⌨️ (1:27:58) Detecting The Player With Sight
⌨️ (1:44:34) Animating Enemy’s Movement
⌨️ (1:49:05) Dealing Damage To The Player And Enemy
⌨️ (1:57:27) Gameplay UI
⌨️ (2:04:55) Displaying Countdown Timer
⌨️ (2:20:04) Enemy Health UI
⌨️ (2:26:21) The Door Script
⌨️ (2:34:43) Creating The Level

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 AppWrite

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Rotogas
topLevelComment.text:
My Gun doesn't spawn.
I'm using UnrealEngine 5.0.3.

In the Charecter Blue Print, the Gun Shows up and I mapped SK_FPGun to the Skeletal Mesh. I just doesn't spawn. I have the exact same Code (until 1:02:21). Checked like 3 times.

But the gun just doesn't show up. What am I doing wrong? Help!

replies.author: Rotogas
replies.text:
Fixed, it. Don't kown what exactly did the trick, but here is what I did:

I removed the Blue Prints, that were pre generated under the All>Content>FirstPerson>Blueprints folder. Which just killed the whole game. So I went under settings to world settings and set the "GameMode Override" to our "BP_MonsterShooterGameMode". That did the Trick. The deleting probably didn't help but cleaned at least my directory

topLevelComment.author: Max Fun
topLevelComment.text:
The download doesnt include the Hands Meshes and code, only the vampire stuff. Edit: I started with the fps template this time.
I am the @1:42:30 mark, does anyone else also have the problem where the vampire is turning but not moving?

Thanks awesometuts and freecodecamp. Also this is one of the best unreal tutorials on youtube.

topLevelComment.author: HungryHusky
topLevelComment.text: The player projectile affects the sight of the enemy - it will count as obscuring it's detection mechanism. How would you fix this?

replies.author: MrEmptyspace
replies.text: I fixed this issue by changing the collision responses to ignore visibility traces. Its an option on the collision sphere for the projectile.

replies.author: MeemBeen
replies.text: Move the camera out of your character and attach it to a spring arm component. There you go, instant third person.

topLevelComment.author: YeetusBoiRyan
topLevelComment.text: Hello, for creating the player character, I am getting a error that says LogCompile: Error: Unknown variable specifier 'Catergory'. Is this something I should be worried about?

replies.author: Max Fun
replies.text: You need to spell the specifier correctly. Category = YourCategory.

topLevelComment.author: Muntean Ionut
topLevelComment.text:
Everything you post is such high-quality content! Thank you very much! I just beecame a member. If everybody would be willing to share their craft for free, the world be a so much better place! May God help you and keep you all healthy so that you can keep on delivering such valuable learning resources!

Also, I would looove to see a comprehensive RabbitMQ and ELK stack (ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana) tutorial. Would be very much appreciated! Or I would appreciate it if anybody could point me to other already existing good resources (looking for something like Colt Steele's Web Dev Bootcamp, an extraordinay learning material).

All the best to everybody!
